data.text:
Third Generation

37. Samuel COMSTOCK33 was born on 6 February 1679/80 in Norwalk, Fairfield County, Connecticut.33,65 He died on 26 October 1752 at the age of 73 in Norwalk, Fairfield County, Connecticut.40,66

Samuell, son of Christopher Comstock, b. 6 Feb 1679/80, married Sarah Hanford, daughter of Rev. Thomas Hanford, 27 Dec 1705.

Sarah Comstock, ye daughter of Samuell, borne March 25, 1707

Samuell, born Nov. 12, 1708

Mary, born Aug 5, 1710

The Ancient Historical Records of Norwalk, Connecticut, p. 195-196

NewEnglandAncestors.com

Probate Records of Fairfield County, Connecticut, 1704-1757

Will Vol 10

1743 Comstock

Comstock, Samuel, Captain, late of Norwalk, will dated Aug.86, 1743, probated Feb., 6, 1753, mentioned his wife,no name, and children Nathan, Daniel, David, Lidea,Sarah Betts, and Mary Trowbridge, legacy to Nehemiah Mead. Executors his sons. Witnesses John Betts, Jonathan Williams and Stepen Rogers, page 391.Inventory taken Dec. 25. 1752, by Samuel Fitch and Joseph Platt, and filed. Feb. 6, 1753, page 393.

Will Vol 11

1754 Comstock

Comstock, Samuel, Captain, late of Nor walk, Jan. 10. 1754, we Daniel Betts, Jr. of Norwalk, John Trowbridge of Danbury, and Lydia Comstock of Norwalk, acknowledge the receipt from Nathan Comstock, Daniel Comstock,and David Comstock, all of Norwalk, executors of the will of our hounored father Captain SamuelComstock, deceased, the whole share belonging to Sarah wife of said Betts, Mary wife of said Trowbridge, and said Lydia. Signed Daniel Betts, Jr.,

Sarah Betts, John Trowbridge, Mary Trowbridge, and Lydia Comstock. Witnesses Andrew Burr and Thomas Hill, page 99.

FindAGrave.com

Capt.Samuel Comstock

Birth: 1679

Death: Oct. 26, 1752

In the 73d year of his age.

"Capt. Samuel Comstock .. was the Son-in-law of Rev. Thomas Hanford having married his youngest daughter Sarah Dec. 17, 1765. She was born May 1677."

"Inscriptions in the Cemetery at Norwalk", copied in 1892 by David Van Hoosear

Burial:

East Norwalk Historical Cemetery

Norwalk

Fairfield County

Connecticut, USA

Wikipedia:

Samuel Comstock (February 6, 1680 â October 26, 1752) was a member of the Connecticut House of Representatives from Norwalk in the sessions of October 1711, October 1714, May 1720, October 1723, October 1725, October 1726, October 1727, October 1728, October 1729, and October 1730.

He was the son of Christopher Comstock and Hannah Platt. The Ancient Historical Records of Norwalk, Connecticut, p. 195

Samuel COMSTOCK and Sarah HANFORD were married on 27 December 1705.40 Sarah HANFORD , daughter of Thomas HANFORD and Mary [HANFORD], was born (date unknown).

FindAGrave memorial has chosen to give Sarah the same death date as her husband - this is doubtful. There is no picture - there is in nothing to prove she was ever buried in Norwalk Historical Cemetery where she's said to have been buried.

Samuel COMSTOCK and Sarah HANFORD had the following children:
